intro: Racosperma havilandiorum, commonly known as the Haviland's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its yellow flowers are arranged in spikes and bloom during the warmer months. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
